discussion.content:
The reason A is important, is that unless an Owner is specified, the Salesforce User doing the import will become the Owner of all the records being imported. That would mean the Admin would have to do another data job or use the Mass Transfer tool to change the Owners after the records are created. That will be much harder than setting the Owner before the import.

https://trailblazers.salesforce.com/answers?id=90630000000hkilAAA
The Data Import Wizard allows you to match records in multiple ways to prevent duplicates. You can match contacts by Salesforce ID, name, email, or external ID.
de dup is an extra feature of Import Wizard, import un-clean data is not recommended.
Doesn't this depend on which of the import tools you are using? If you are using the Import Wizard it is not necessary to de-dupe...

comments.content: Because this question library includes many technically very outdated questions, and Saleforce uses certification exams to gauge people from the fees hence stupid questions very common.

choices.B: Validation rules are not triggered when importing data using the import wizard
choices.C: Data should be de-duplicated in the import file prior to import
choices.D: Currency field values will default to the personal currency of the record owner
choices.A: The import file should include a record owner for each record

questions.question_text: What should a system administrator consider before importing a set of records into Salesforce.
Custom Summary Formulas can run calculations on custom formula fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A custom summary formula offers you the ability to calculate additional totals based on the numeric fields available in the report, including the record count.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000383833&type=1
=> Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience
Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Administrators can create a maximum of 1,500 custom profiles per user license type

Yes, answer is False.
Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience
Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, and Database.com Editions
Administrators can create a maximum of 1,500 custom profiles per user license type.
Note: For Professional Edition, the maximum number of custom profiles they can create is 2.

Is this supposed to be false? 
As per https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=000319518&language=en_US&type=1&mode=1
Administrators can create a maximum of 1,500 custom profiles per user license type.
